column4: So, on to the questions, anyone feel like helping me run Heron at 1440x900 with only integrated graphics?
Currently stuck at 1280x800 and everything is too big.
The only help Google is tossing me is for nvidia.
To get 1440x900 without an nVidia card, I'm assuming (from what I've read) that I'll need to muck around with Xorg?
Anyone familiar with it?
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg ?
I'll be honest, I'm taking a shot in the dark, I'm not familiar enough to claim I know what I'm doing.
tpye in console this command and floow instructions on screen -  dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
I'll give it a shot.
when u get to resolution part, mark 1400x900

I'm toying around with reconfiguring xorg, but it's asking me for a keyboard layout. It won't let me push OK or pick a certain layout. Nor does it have anywhere to type it in. Am I missing something here?
Nevermind. I'm just being dense.
keep default
After all the keyboard settings, I'm returned to console. There are no video settings.
at end it should ask you advanced
It echoes, "xserver-xorg postinst warning: overwriting possibly-customised configuration
b4 that part chevck for advanced option and there u should edit that modes manualy

It's asks me if it wants me to use the kernel framebuffer device interface, and no matter what I choose, it sends me to the keyboard stuff. At the very end, it asks for Keyboard options, but after that, it just throws me back to console.
uwhat card u got ?
Is that like an uprising?
joke :)
Someone should start it, then :P
